oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-10-12 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 12, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys and June Webb, guest performer Jean Shepard, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Howdy Forrester, Pap's Jug Band, Randy Hughes, Rod Brasfield, and Bashful Brother Oswald. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. On this show John H. DeWitt Jr., president of WSM, presents Roy Acuff with an award in celebration of his twentieth anniversary performing on WSM and the Opry. It is announced that this is the 940th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Jordanaires; Jean Shepard; Howdy Forrester; June Webb
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Sunshine Special (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Jordanaires -- Dig A Little Deeper (Jordanaires) -- Roy Acuff introduces Jean Shepard -- It Scares Me Half To Death (Jean Shepard) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Howdy Forrester -- Golden Eagle Hornpipe (Howdy Forrester fiddle) -- Grant Turner introduces John H. DeWitt Jr. -- John H. DeWitt Jr. presents Roy Acuff with an award in celebration of his twentieth anniversary performing on WSM and the Opry -- I Saw The Light (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Jordanaires, June Webb, Jean Shepard)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States. (John Hibbett), 1906-1999
